Class GameState

java.lang.Object
com.jeopardy.model.GameState
public class GameState extends Object
Represents the current state of an entire Jeopardy game session.

This class tracks:

  • The list of players and questions in the game
  • The current player and their index
  • The overall game status (SETUP, IN_PROGRESS, FINISHED)
  • Logic for determining winners and detecting ties

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final String
    FINISHED
    Game has ended and final scores are available.
    static final String
    IN_PROGRESS
    Game is actively in progress.
    static final String
    SETUP
    Game is being configured (players/questions not yet in active play).

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameState()
    Creates a new GameState with empty player and question lists, status set to SETUP, and the current player index at 0.

      Game is being configured (players/questions not yet in active play).

      public static final String IN_PROGRESS
      Game is actively in progress.

      public static final String FINISHED
      Game has ended and final scores are available.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • GameState

      public GameState()
      Creates a new GameState with empty player and question lists, status set to SETUP, and the current player index at 0.

  • Method Details

    • getPlayers

      public List<Player> getPlayers()
      Returns the list of players in the game.
      Returns:
      the list of players

    • setPlayers

      public void setPlayers(List<Player> players)
      Replaces the current list of players with the given list.
      Parameters:
      players - the new list of players

    • getQuestions

      public List<Question> getQuestions()
      Returns the list of questions in the game.
      Returns:
      the list of questions

    • setQuestions

      public void setQuestions(List<Question> questions)
      Replaces the current list of questions with the given list.
      Parameters:
      questions - the new list of questions

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Returns the player whose turn it is.
      Returns:
      the current player, or null if no players have been added

    • setCurrentPlayer

      public void setCurrentPlayer(Player currentPlayer)
      Explicitly sets the current player.
      Parameters:
      currentPlayer - the player whose turn it should be

    • getStatus

      public String getStatus()
      Returns the current game status.
      Returns:
      one of SETUP, IN_PROGRESS, FINISHED

    • setStatus

      public void setStatus(String status)
      Updates the game status.
      Parameters:
      status - the new status value

    • getCurrentPlayerIndex

      public int getCurrentPlayerIndex()
      Returns the index of the current player within the players list.
      Returns:
      the current player index

    • setCurrentPlayerIndex

      public void setCurrentPlayerIndex(int currentPlayerIndex)
      Sets the current player index.
      Parameters:
      currentPlayerIndex - the index of the current player

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer(Player player)
      Adds a player to the game.

      If this is the first player added, they also become the current player.

      Parameters:
      player - the player to add

    • addQuestion

      public void addQuestion(Question question)
      Adds a question to the game.
      Parameters:
      question - the question to add

    • nextPlayer

      public void nextPlayer()
      Moves to the next player in the list, wrapping back to the beginning once the end is reached.

      If there are no players, this method does nothing.

    • isGameFinished

      public boolean isGameFinished()
      Checks whether the game has finished.
      Returns:
      true if the status is FINISHED, otherwise false

    • determineWinners

      public List<Player> determineWinners()
      Determines the winning player(s) based on the highest score.

      If there are no players, an empty list is returned. If multiple players share the highest score, they are all included in the result.

      Returns:
      a list of players who have the highest score

    • isTie

      public boolean isTie()
      Checks whether the game ended in a tie (more than one winner).
      Returns:
      true if multiple players share the highest score, false otherwise

    • getGameResult

      public String getGameResult()
      Builds a human-readable result message describing the outcome of the game.
      • Returns "No winners!" if there were no players.
      • Returns a single-winner message if exactly one winner exists.
      • Returns a tie message listing all winners and their scores.
      Returns:
      a formatted string describing the game result

    • getWinner

      public Player getWinner()
      Returns a single winner if there is one, or the first winner in the list when there are multiple winners.
      Returns:
      the winning player, or null if there are no winners
